title: Madol Duwa
author: Martin Wickramasinghe
description: Madol Duwa is a celebrated children's novel in Sri Lanka. It tells the adventurous story of young Upali and his island escapades.

title: Viragaya
author: Martin Wickramasinghe
description: Viragaya is a celebrated Sinhala novel that is an intellectual and emotional study, exploring human nature and social conventions.

title: Gamperaliya
author: Martin Wickramasinghe
description: Gamperaliya is a landmark novel in Sinhala literature that depicts the transitional period in rural society.

title: Kaliyugaya
author: Martin Wickramasinghe
description: Kaliyugaya is the second part of the Gamperaliya trilogy, describing the challenges of rural life in the modern age.

title: Yuganthaya
author: Martin Wickramasinghe
description: Yuganthaya is the final part of the Gamperaliya trilogy, completing the social transformation narrative.

title: Wilambeetha
author: T. B. Ilangaratne
description: Wilambeetha is an important psychological novel in modern Sinhala literature.

title: Hath Pana
author: Kumarathunga Munidasa
description: Hath Pana is a collection of funny stories that celebrates the beauty of Sinhala language and culture.

title: Malagiya Attho
author: K. Jayatilaka
description: Malagiya Attho is a remarkable work in Sinhala dramatic literature.

title: Ape Gama
author: Martin Wickramasinghe
description: A semi-autobiographical novel based on the author's own childhood experiences in his village of Koggala, exploring simple life and traditions.

title: Amba Yahaluwo
author: T.B. Ilangaratne
description: A celebrated novel about the strong friendship between two boys, Nimal and Sunil, who come from vastly different social and economic classes.

title: Senkottan
author: Mahinda Prasad Masimbula
description: An award-winning modern classic that highlights the struggles of the Dhobi (Rada) community, exploring social stigma and poverty in early 20th-century Sri Lanka.

title: Hevanella
author: Siri Gunasinghe
description: A landmark novel in Sinhala literature, 'Hevanella' (The Shadow) is celebrated for its pioneering use of the 'stream of consciousness' technique to explore the complex inner world and thoughts of its protagonist.

title: Golu Hadawatha
author: Karunasena Jayalath
description: A classic and immensely popular Sinhala romance, 'Golu Hadawatha' (The Silent Heart) tells the poignant story of the unspoken love between two teenagers, Sugath and Dammi, from their differing perspectives.

title: Maname
author: Ediriweera Sarachchandra
description: The published script of the seminal Sinhala play that revived traditional 'Nadagam' (folk drama) theatre. It is a cornerstone of Sri Lankan theatrical literature, based on the Chulla Dhanuggaha Jataka tale.

title: Sakwa Lihini
author: Mahagama Sekara
description: An iconic and influential collection of modern Sinhala poetry. Mahagama Sekara's work is celebrated for its profound, lyrical, and free-verse style, breaking from classical traditions.

title: Kele Handa
author: W. A. Silva
description: A classic novel set in Sri Lanka's past, blending romance and adventure against a backdrop of traditional village life and colonial influence. It tells the story of Malini and her lover, Asela.

title: Kuda Hora
author: Sybil Wettasinghe
description: An internationally acclaimed and iconic picture book, 'Kuda Hora' (The Umbrella Thief) is celebrated for its charming illustrations and simple, imaginative story about a boy and a mushroom.

title: Gehenu Lamayi
author: Karunasena Jayalath
description: A popular novel that followed 'Golu Hadawatha', 'Gehenu Lamayi' (The Girls) explores the lives, friendships, and romantic experiences of a group of adolescent schoolgirls in a rural setting.

title: Suba saha Yasa
author: Simon Navagattegama
description: The published script for a highly symbolic and famous stage play. It explores themes of power, freedom, and social convention through the story of a prince and his servant who switch roles.

title: Mala Nonala Minisa
author: Kumara Siriwardena
description: A popular modern horror novel by Kumara Siriwaradena, one of the key contemporary figures in Sinhala horror/thriller fiction, often dealing with supernatural elements and intense suspense.

title: Anduru Wanapetha
author: Manel Jayanthi Gunasekara
description: A contemporary horror title that translates to 'The Dark Forest', exploring elements of local folklore and intense suspense, fitting into the growing trend of mainstream Sinhala horror.

title: Sansararanyaye Dadayakkaraya
author: Simon Navagattegama
description: Meaning 'The Hunter in the Jungle of Samsara,' this novel by Navagattegama often blends philosophy with dark, intense narratives that explore moral ambiguity and predatory human behavior.
